intro: Licania aspera, commonly known as the rough licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, lobed leaves that are covered in a rough, textured surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Licania aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
